column1: a juicy half-volley outside off, Rohit just leans into it and creams it through covers, off the mark with a boundary
pitched up again, Rohit comes forward and pushes it gently towards mid-off
length, but way too outside off, left alone

a direct hit and Rohit would have been out. Was fuller again, Rohit nudges it to the left of Warner at mid-off and sets off. Dhawan sends him back but Warner has a shy at the striker's end. Rohit is well short but Warner fails to nail it
Starc goes full once again but no swing on offer so far. Caressed through extra cover on this occasion for the second boundary of the over
shortens his length a touch this time, Rohit was looking to push it towards covers, gets an inside edge towards backward square leg
length ball around middle and off, Dhawan looks to drive but gets an inside edge onto the pads
length ball slanting across the left-hander, Dhawan comes forward and opens the face of the bat to guide it towards third man
length ball on middle and leg, tucked away towards square leg

beauty! Cummins shows why he is the best bowler in the world right now. Comes in with the angle, pitching on a length around off and then moving away off the seam to beat the bat. Rohit was left pushing at it
length ball again but down the leg side this time, a wide
length on middle and leg, flicked towards fine leg
length, in the corridor, left alone
fuller around off, comes forward and presents the full face, rolls towards mid-off
length ball on the leg stump, tucked away behind square leg
fuller around off, pushes with hard hands, the ball hits the inner half and goes towards square leg
length outside off, comes forward and taps it towards point
length ball straying down the leg side, Dhawan misses the flick. The ball hits the thigh pad and goes towards square leg
short of length outside off, good bounces for Starc. Rohit gets on his toes and drops it on the off side
length, angling across, Dhawan goes for a drive on the up, looking to hit squarer, misses
short of length around fifth stump, left alone
length ball in the channel once again, shouldered arms
length, just around off, a big front-foot stride and a solid defence
bangs it short this time, just outside off and angling away, Dhawan stays away from it
and that's a maiden. A testing over. This was on a length around fourth stump, Dhawan watches it closely before shouldering arms
length ball down the leg side, Rohit misses out on the flick, off the thigh pad and into the mitts of Carey
length ball around middle, 138kph, defended on the leg side

Warner takes a low catch at mid-off. Cross seam and not that full, was angling away from the batsman. Rohit looks to hit it down the ground but it comes slower off the surface. The bat faces closes a touch too early as well. As a result it goes tamely towards Warner, just carrying to him. Think Rohit was looking to go over extra cover
length ball around off, comes forward and blocks
length ball around fifth stump, left alone
goes for the yorker, 143.1kph, but doesn't get the line right. Down the leg side and Rahul just clips it towards the fine leg boundary
just short of an incoming Zampa from third man. Was banged in short, Dhawan arches back and ramps it over. Zampa moves forward and to his right but it falls just in front of him
length ball on middle and leg, flicked towards fine leg, more work for Zampa
short of length around off, stays back and punches it towards point
length around off, comes forward and drives it towards mid-off, a good-looking short for no runs

length again, Dhawan looks to flick it on the leg side, misses and is hit on the pads. An appeal for lbw but looked like it pitched outside leg, Australia want to review. Front foot is fine, no bat involved but as expected, it had landed outside leg . Australia lose their review
length around leg stump once again, this one just holds it line to hit Dhawan in the abdomen
length ball around off, looks to punch through covers, gets an inside edge onto the pads that ricochets on the leg side
length ball around off, pushes it towards cover
short of length at the batsman, Dhawan goes back and whips it towards short midwicket
a touch fuller around off, drives it to the right of Warner at mid-off, a direct hit would have been interesting
length ball on middle and leg, flicked towards square leg
length ball around off, stays back and defends with a straight bat
a searing yorker, just outside off, Dhawan stays inside the line and looks to get his bat down. Beaten as the ball just shapes away
yorker again, this time at the stumps, Dhawan manages to get his bat on it, squeezes it out towards covers
pitched up once more, Dhawan takes a couple of steps towards the bowler and drives it between the non-striker and mid-on

fuller and flicked this time, was in the air and not far away from a flying Labuschagne at short midwicket, might have got his fingertips as well but Dhawan had got enough on it to carry it to the fence. Yes, Labuschagne got some hand to it
fuller outside off, goes for the drive but fails to middle, gets a single to mid-off
length ball angling away from Rahul, shouldered arms
short of length, Dhawan goes back and pulls it wide of long-on, three fours for him in last four balls
length ball around off, hops back and defends
length ball around off, pushes it towards covers
this is poor from Richardson. Short and down the leg side with third man in the ring. Dhawan happily pulls it past that fielder and picks up another boundary
much better, short of length around off, stays back and chops it towards point
length ball around middle, comes forward and defends it towards the bowler
short of length around off, gets on his toes and defends
short of length outside off, looked like Rahul was in two minds for a moment, whether to play or leave. Dabs it past slip in the end
fuller around off, and Dhawan is looking imperious now. Drives it to the right of the diving Warner at mid-off
length but way outside off, left alone
short of length on the pads, tucked away towards fine leg

fuller on the pads, flicked towards short midwicket, Labuschagne makes a partial stop and deflects it towards the mid-on but the fielder there was already moving to his right to cover Labuschagne. The batsmen eventually take a single
fuller around off, just short of a yorker, punches it towards mid-on
fuller outside off, goes for the drive but cannot beat the extra cover fielder
fuller on the pads, flicked to the left of fine leg, Cummins moves across swiftly to keep it to one
length ball around off, stays in his crease and defends it towards mid-off
slower one, 117kph, fuller on the stumps, flicks it towards fine leg
length ball around off, punches towards mid-off
length ball around off, dabs it on the off side and looks to sneak in but both the point and the cover fielders were quick to the ball
extra bounce for Cummins to beat Dhawan's attempted cut. Was a length ball around off, Dhawan went for it but no connection. There was an appeal for caught-behind from Cummins but no bat there
short of length around off, once again rising towards the batsman, stays back and defends it on the off side
fuller around off, punched firmly but cannot beat mid-off
short of length outside off, Dhawan takes half a step towards the leg side and ramps it over. Made sure he hit it away from the third man fielder this time
this time to the left of the third man. Short of length outside off, steered it behind point to finsih the over with back-to-back four
tossed up around off, comes forward and drives it towards sweeper cover
fuller and on the pads, flicked towards deep-backward square leg
fuller on the leg stump, driven towards long-on for another easy single
fuller on middle and leg, Dhawan pushes it towards deep midwicket
too full outside off, looks to squeeze it out fine, misses
length ball on middle and leg, defended from the front foot
fuller but way too outside off, Dhawan ignores it
length ball on middle and leg, tucked away towards square leg
length ball around off, punched square off the wicket, beating the backward point fielder and 50-run stand - off 54 balls - comes off with that four
length ball on middle and leg, tucked away towards square leg
length ball around off, defended towards covers this time
almost dabbed on to his stumps, a length ball around off, Rahul looks to defend with soft hands, off the face of the bat and onto the pads
length ball around off, looks to push towards covers, an inside edge towards square leg

fuller outside off, bowled from wide of the crease. Rahul looks to drive through extra cover. Gets a thick outside edge but does well to open the face of the bat so that the ball goes to the right of short third man
length ball but sliding down the leg side
fuller around off, pushes it towards the sweeper cover from the front foot
fuller on the stumps, driven back towards the bowler
length ball around off, comes forward and defends it towards cover
length around off, defended again on the off side
short of length, Dhawan rocks back and pulls but cannot get the timing right. Short midwicket makes the stop
shortish in length, and slanting down the leg side, and he whips it along the ground towards fine leg
down the leg side, and he helps it along towards fine leg
length, slants into him, and he defends towards square leg
down the leg side, and he places this to the left of fine leg. Just a little roll of the wrists, and he knows he has placed this well enough. Top shot!
drives a length ball, leaning forward. It eludes the grasp of cover, who makes a half-stop. Easy single
cutter, around his pads, and he whips it off his pads towards fine leg
floated up to middle, and he sweeps this hard. Cannot get it past short fine leg
length, angles across him before it straightens, and he blocks it
chips down the wicket and tries to flick a length ball away. Cannot beat Finch at mid-wicket
full ball, down the leg side, and he plays a little paddle sweep fine enough. Easy pickings, and bad ball!

slower, around off stump, and he nurdles it around the corner. Man at deep backward square leg has to run around to his left and pick it up near the long leg boundary, and they come through for the second

length, and he plays this towards mid-off. He sets off, and then stops. Rahul stops after coming a few steps down the track. Dhawan can regain his composure and recover ground before the throw comes in at his end.
short, and he goes back and cuts this hard. Gets it past point, but the man at the deep point fence is able to cut it off
floated in from deeper behind the popping crease, and he whips it towards mid-wicket
full, wide of off, and he slaps this hard towards the sweeper at deep point
full, around leg stump, and he looks to sweep. Cannot place it beyond short fine-leg
down the leg side, and he looks to sweep. Close to being called wide, but it might have just nicked part of his leg
wrong 'un, and he goes back and punches this towards long-on
length, turns back in from outside off, and he tries a delicate late cut. Cannot beat short third man
fuller, wider, and he runs it down towards deep point with a little flourish of the wrists. Fielded by deep backward point, away to his right
length, around off and middle, and he whips it away but straight towards square leg
length, and he presses forward to drive it back towards the bowler
steps out, and looks to slog this down the ground. Runs off the inner part of the bat and runs along the ground to long-on
length, and he presses forward to defend this. Runs towards point, and he comes four-five steps down the wicket before being sent back
length, down the leg side, and he whips it away towards long leg. That's 50 for Dhawan!
length, driven down towards long-on
driven back to the bowler
slogs a fuller ball away towards deep mid-wicket. Does well to keep it well to the right of deep backward square
fuller, and he stretches forward to drive this down towards long-off
length, and he drives this towards cover
length, and he shuffles across to whip this away. Misses out on contact
dropped, but what an effort! Full ball, and he slaps it away low towards mid-wicket, where Warner dives to his right. Gets his fingers to it, but cannot hold on
leans back and punches this towards the sweeper at extra cover
length, and he moves around the crease, before tapping this towards short third man
fuller, a touch wider, and he steers this past point towards the man at deep point
flatter, straighter, and he goes back and punches this towards long-on
length ball, just around off, and he looks to whip this towards mid-wicket. Miscues a touch, but it goes along the ground towards long leg
full, and he drives this back towards long-on
length, and he comes down the wicket and punches this back down the wicket. Fielded by Zampa away to his left
drives back towards the bowler, who stops it well to his right
wrong 'un, and he flicks this towards deep mid-wicket
slower, outisde off, and he punches this towards deep point, opening the face of the bat, to retain strike
length, and he hangs back to punch this towards point
goes back to punch a ball that was fired in quicker, towards fine leg, and he misses out. Hits him too high on the pads though
tries to run another one fired at his pads towards fine leg, but short fine leg keeps it down to just one
length, and punched towards sweeper cover
drives a length ball towards cover
length, defends off the back foot
length, a bit of width outside off, and he goes back to punch this towards deep point
fuller, and he drives this hard back down the pitch. Eludes Zampa, perhaps just scraping his fingers as it goes along. Allows long-on to cut this off
floated around leg stump, and he sweeps this towards long leg. Well done by the man at the deep backward square leg fence, moving away to his left
length, and he defends towards point
short, quicker, and he whips it with the turn towards deep backward square. Some hard running fetches the batsmen two
full, and he looks to hit this hard down the ground, Cannot get under the ball as he would like, and ends up driving it to long-on
length, and he defends this towards point
length, and he stretches forward to drive this towards sweeper at cover
down the wicket, and chips this over the long-off fence. Use of the feet the key, as the line of the ball was wide, but all he needed to do was clear the infield, with the man stationed at mid-off
tapped away towards square leg for a quick single
chips down the wicket, and drives a length ball towards long-off
length, and he shuffles across to defend this right at the crease
fuller, just around off, and he drives this hard towards sweeper at cover
length, and he slaps this towards deep mid-wicket. On the bounce towards the fielder in the deep
shorter, and he goes back and drives it back towards the bowler
length, driven back towards the bowler

this is interesting. The ball goes through Rahul, looks to have taken a little tickle, and then Carey comes up with a good take. Australia appeal but the umpires refer this to television. The soft signal is not out! It bounces on its way through to Carey. Shall stay not out
length, driven out towards sweeper cover
fuller length, and he plays a gorgeous drive, just to the left of mid-off. Cummins fields and has a shy at the non-striker's end. Just misses, though Rahul was well in
short, scrambled-seam from the look of things, and he plays it towards point. A slight misfield, and the ball does go wide enough to allow a run to be pinched
length, punched towards deep point
slower ball, fuller, and he drives this towards mid-on
short ball, slower through the air, and he slaps this towards deep mid-wicket
length, and he opens the face of the bat to run it towards deep point

GONE! Chips a length ball in the air, just doesn't get to the pitch of one floated around off. Perhaps gripped a bit on the pitch too, and he just drives this straight to Steve Smith at cover. Loud cheers, as the crowd prepare for Virat Kohli
drives hard towards long-off, with a good forward stride in towards the ball
length, down the leg side, and he sweeps, and again plays it straight to short fine-leg
length, and he tries to flick this. Off his pads, towards short fine-leg and they quickly switch ends for a leg-bye
length, and he stretches to drive towards cover
fired in flatter, and he goes back and drives this towards long-on
length, and he taps this towards point and sets off. There's a shy at the striker's end, and Dhawan just about makes it! No direct hit, at any rate
fuller length, and he whips this away towards long leg. One bounce to the fielder stationed there
full ball, wide of the off stump, and Kohli fails to make contact as he looks to swipe it away. Within the tramlines
length, and he drives this towards sweeper cover

Dhawan goes! Must have been a change of pace, because Dhawan got that nowhere near where he wanted to play it. Just looks to flick it away, and the outside edge carries it towards cover. Ashton Agar runs in from mid-off and takes a good, diving catch away to his right. The set man is gone, as the bowling change makes a difference immediately for Finch!
reaches out to a length ball around off, and runs it down towards third man
wrong 'un, down the pads, and Kohli whips it away towards deep backward square
length, flicks it away towards mid-wicket
length, and he pushes this towards long-off
length, driven towards sweeper cover
length, strays a touch down the pads, and he can flick it towards square leg
flighted, around off, and he drives this towards sweeper cover
dug in short, and Iyer ducks out of the way. Called wide for the length
length, driven back hard towards Cummins, who stops it with his right hand. Had Kohli scrambling, just in case that had gone back to the stumps at the non-striker's end
length, defended on the off side
length, bowled at 145kph, and he defends this from the crease
length, played away towards deep square leg
length, just runs off the outside edge as Kohli has a nibble at it. Evades slip, and goes along the ground down to third man
short, well-directed, and he weaves away to avoid this one
very short ball, and gets the right treatment! Rocks back, and swings this over the long leg fence. Just went over, in the end, but good enough to fetch half a dozen

he's gotten his revenge! Kohli falls to Zampa again! Driven hard, to a ball that was floated around off, and he just couldn't keep it away from Zampa, who takes a sharp chance and then punches the air. Important breakthrough for Australia at this stage, as it exposes the relatively soft underbelly of the Indian batting, with a good way to cover in this innings
tossed up around off, and Pant comes forward and smashes this googly through covers
fuller around off, nudges it back towards the bowler
length ball on the stumps, stays back and turns it on the leg side
fuller on the stumps, driven to the left of the bowler for a single to long-on
fuller around off, punches it back towards the bowler
length ball on middle and leg, tucked away towards deep square leg
a short one to put Iyer in a tangle. Was on middle and leg and Iyer found himself fending at it in an awkward position, a single as the ball drops on the leg side
length ball at the stumps, flicked towards backward square leg

and the move to bring Starc back has worked. Don't think it was a special delivery though, a length ball angling away, Iyer pushes away from the body and gets an outside edge, a simple catch for Carey behind the stumps
goes for the yorker, just outside off. Jadeja jams his bat at it, but the ball hardly goes anywhere. He was looking to run a single but Starc was quick in his followthrough to prevent it
length ball outside off, goes for the cut but cannot beat short third man
a touch fuller and flatter outside off, left alone
a googly, length outside off, cuts it towards backward point
low full toss outside off, drives it towards wide long-off
another googly. Wide outside off, lunges forward and pushes it towards covers
a full toss outside off, Jadeja works it towards long-on
length ball around off, comes forward and blocks
fuller on the stumps, flicked but cannot beat short midwicket
length ball outside off, left alone
slower one at 128.8kph, length outside off. Jadeja comes forward and pushes it into the covers
144kph, attempted yorker but down the leg side, given a wide
gets the yorker right this time, but Pant manages to get some bat on it, an inside edge onto the pads. An appeal for lbw but they run a single to fine leg
another attempt for the yorker but this time Starc ends up bowling a full toss at the stumps, pushed back towards the bowler
length but down the leg side, Pant looks to sweep it fine but misses
length ball at the stumps, punched towards short midwicket from the back foot
length ball at the stumps, goes back but mistimes the pull towards short fine leg
length ball at the stumps, flicked towards short midwicket
length ball on the pads, flicked towards deep-backward square leg

fuller, angled across the batsman. Jadeja goes down and slog sweeps it over deep midwicket. For a moment it looked like the fielder at the boundary had a chance but it kept sailing and cleared him comfortably
length ball at the stumps, flicked towards square leg
length ball around off and middle, turned to the leg side
short of length outside off, stays back and dabs it towards third man
length but way outside off, Jadeja lets it go through to the keeper

short of length outside off, Jadeja just steers it behind point, Zampa with the desperate dive to his left at third man, he gets his hand but Starc's pace means it's travelling way too fast for him to stop it
length ball on the pads, flicked behind square on the leg side
fuller and wider outside off, left alone
length ball around off, punched back towards the bowler who fumbles. Jadeja was looking for a single but the mid-on fielder was quick to tidy it up
length ball on the pads, too quick for Jadeja to pull it, ends up dabbing behind the stumps
flatter and quicker at the stumps, flicked towards short midwicket
length ball on the pads, misses the pull and is hit on the pads
gives himself some room and goes for the pull, the ball lobs towards short midwicket, Jadeja was looking for the run but Pant wisely sends him back
and that's a maiden. Length ball at the stumps, punched towards extra cover
length ball outside leg and angling in, Pant misses the flick and is rapped on the pads. An appeal for lbw but Cummins realises it had pitched outside leg
fuller and wider outside off, pushes it towards covers
fuller but down the leg side, clipped towards fine leg
length ball around off, stays back and defends towards extra cover
length ball at the stumps, gives himself room and looks to go over the top with both mid-on and mid-off inside the circle. Mistimes though and it bounces it towards mid-on

short of length outside off, dabs it towards the left of the third man, and he is sprinting back for the second. A direct hit and they are checking upstairs. Richardson is the fielder but Jadeja was dragging his bat and was well inside
short and down the leg side, Pant goes for the pull but only a single to fine leg, missed out there
length ball angling across, looks to punch off the back foot, gets beaten
this time connects the punch and scampers back for the second as the ball goes towards sweeper cover
fuller on the stumps, pushes it towards long-on
short of length down the leg side, once again pulled towards fine leg
length but room outside off, Jadeja waits for it and cuts it behind point for four
fuller around off, drives it towards covers
fuller and wider, drives it towards sweeper cover, the bottom hand comes off the bat
short of length around off, gets on his toes and drops it on the off side for a quick single
play and a miss. A length outside off, Pant looks to smash it over extra cover but loses his shape, fails to connect
length ball down the leg side, goes for the pull but cannot middle it, the ball bounces to the right of Carey
length ball down the leg side, Jadeja looks to flick it fine but misses. Called a wide
length ball around off, opens the face of the bat to run it towards third man, 200 comes up for India
length ball on the pads, misses the flick but hares down to the other end for a leg-byw
102kph, uses his feet and hoicks it over deep midwicket, all the way for a six
a full toss this time, 105kph. Slapped towards deep midwicket
another full toss, 102.7kph. Jadeja misses out. Finds short midwicket
fuller on the pads, clipped towards midwicket
103.1kph, walks towards the bowler once again and absolutely drills it between deep midwicket and long-on

length ball at the batsman, was a knuckle delivery, bounces extra as well. Jadeja was looking to run it down towards third man but the ball hits near the shoulder of the bat and an easy catch for Carey
fuller outside off and absolutely smoked towards deep cover, there is a sweeper though
slower length ball outside off, opens the face of the bat for a single to third man
fuller around off, flicks it towards mid-on
short of length outside off, goes for the pull but cannot middle it, lobs in the air but falls well short of mid-on
short of length outside off, cuts it towards sweeper cover for one
fuller on the pads, clipped behind square leg

a short one hurries onto the Pant who goes for the pull, gets a top edge onto the helmet and it lobs towards point. An easy catch but umpire Shamshuddin is unmoved as everyone looks towards him. Meanwhile, the batsmen are sneaking in single, no direct hit but then the umpire raises his finger. Pant departs after a bit of drama
length ball on the pads, flicked behind square leg
fuller around off, drives it aerially and just to the left of extra cover, neat connection though and he gets four
short but down the leg side, pulls it fine for another boundary, crucial runs these
short of length at the batsman and another good short, pulled towards in front of square leg, keeps the strike with that single
dropped. A full toss at the stumps and lofted towards long-on, not from the middle of the bat. Richardson charges in, a low chance but should have been taken, slips through his fingers

Michael Gough gives it lbw. Shami though wants to review it. Has to. A yorker from around the wicket, Shami misses the flick and it hits him right on the shoe. No bat involved but looks like it was going down. Replays show the impact was in the line of the leg stump but the angle would have taken it down. Shami survives
another attempted yorker, just outside off this time, Shami looks to drive but misses
fuller at the stumps, Shami gets his bat on it this time, driven towards sweeper cover

nails the yorker, it was just a matter of time, Shardul fails to get anything on it and the off stump has been knocked out from its groove. The fact that Shardul was looking to play across the line didn't help either t
a low full toss around off and middle, flicked towards deep square leg
length ball in the channel, looks to defend but ends up playing inside the line
length ball on the pads, flicked towards deep midwicket
length ball at the batsman, a bit of extra bounce as well. Defended from the crease
length ball at the stumps, backs away and goes down the ground. Fails to middle it as it goes over the umpire's head
pushed towards covers for a quick single
fuller outside off and Shami backing away made it look wider than it was. No connection as he tries to reach out for it
fuller outside off, drives it towards deep extra cover
fuller outside off, looks to go over covers by giving himself room. A thick outside edge towards third man
fuller outside off, pushes it towards cover
fuller outside off, pushed towards extra cover
fuller on the stumps, swiped towards square leg
142kph, gets the timing right. Goes for the yorker but ends up bowling a full toss, hits it through covers for four
slower length ball outside off, looks to push on the off side, misses
length ball outside off, steered towards third man
short of length at the stumps, Shami back away and pulls it towards deep midwicket

slower length ball, backs away and tucks it towards midwicket, Richardson chases himself but Shami is charging down for the second. The throw is at the wrong end and there is enough time for Shami to retrace his steps
length ball outside off, backs away and looks to slog, misses
short of length outside off, gives himself room and looks to smash over extra cover, beaten again
fuller ball around off, Kuldeep makes some room and steers it through covers for four
fuller but way down the leg side
length ball on the pads, clipped towards fine leg
fuller at the stumps who backs away and pushes it towards long-on, 250 comes up for India
a length ball around off, Kuldeep backs away and smashes it over the bowler's head, gets a boundary
fuller around off, squeezes it out on the off side and sprints to the other end
a direct hit from Smith and Kuldeep has to go back. Fuller outside off, Shami steered it towards backward point and set off, Smith had all the time to nail the direct hit and he does

length ball at the stumps, backs away and looks to smash across, gets a top edge that goes high and behind the stumps, Carey positions himself under it as it comes spiralling down, the ball pops out of his gloves but he does well to cling to the rebound, between his chin/neck and the glove
length, just around off, and he punches this towards cover, where substitute fielder Manish Pandey stops it
length, a bit of nip away, and takes the outside edge as he looks to drive. Runs along the ground towards third man
bit of swing, but width on offer, and he swings this through the point region. It just about makes it to the fence.
drives this firmly back towards the bowler
length, a bit of movement back in, and he defends with a slight forward press
fuller, straighter, and he drives this to mid-on
length, but a bit too much width. Warner leaves, and Rahul has to scramble away to his left to collect this in front of first slip
shorter, and he looks to flick this away. Off his pads, and pops up around square leg. They pick up a leg bye before the fielder can bring it in
length, and he defends this incoming ball towards point
shorter, and he goes on top of his toes to ride the bounce. Pushes this through the cover-point region, and picks up two before Pandey can pull it back in
length, jags back in from outside off, and Finch leaves it. Trusts the bounce on this surface, but that wasn't far away from the top of off!
length, a hint of movement back in. Finch wants to press forward to defend, and the inward movement makes the bat skew as he blocks
strays down the pads, and he can whip it off his legs towards long leg. Wants two, but has to settle for one as the fielder converges quickly from fine leg

inswinger, but he stretches and smashes this through covers. Top shot from Finch! A short movement forward with his front foot, and then just going with the shot as he would normally do. It's been a mode of dismissal exploited by India in the past, but not this time
strays down the pads with a fuller ball, and he can flick it away towards long leg
full, wide, and he smashes this hard through cover, but the fielder there is quick to cut this off
length, nips back in a touch, and he defends from the crease

ooh, a beauty! Like a very fast off-break, this pitches around off, and then moves away in the air. Warner half-stretches forward to defend, and sees this whizz past his outside edge, through to KL Rahul behind the stumps. Remember again, no Pant
length, around off, and he drives this towards point
shorter, a bit of shape back in, and he cuts this towards point

gorgeous! The length is good, but not as full as what you would consider ideal for the drive. There's a bit of movement back in, and with that Finch just throws his hands at it and strokes it through cover
hint of movement back in, and he uses that to nurdle this towards deep backward square leg. Hard running brings an easy two
short, and he hangs back and punches this through point
length, and he whips this towards fine leg. Off the pad, says the umpire
length, just around off, and he drives this back towards cover
length, around off, and he drives this between cover-point and point. Superb shot, with no chance for either fielder to get anywhere near it!
length, jags back in, and he looks to play this towards the on side. Off the pads, and going down leg, but drops towards square leg
length, driven back towards Shami, who picks it up on his follow-through
length, angles back into him, and he defends this towards cover

length, and he flicks it off his pads towards mid-wicket. There's a fielder there, Shikhar Dhawan, who misfields. Has to chase this all the way to the fence, and he's able to pull it back just in time to prevent four
gets the very first ball to jag back from around the wicket. Strikes Warner as he misses that. Was it missing leg, or perhaps too high? Eventually, there's no review from India
length, and he presses forward to defend this
fuller ball, a hint of movement back in, and Warner drives this towards point

short, down the leg side, and he chases it, and he's been given out caught behind! Warner reviews after a lengthy chat with Finch. This was a terrible ball actually, and deserved the proper treatment it nearly received from the batsman. Did he just get a feather on it, through to Rahul behind the wicket? No. Nothing on that on the broadcast. Warner stays
length, zips in from outside off, and he flicks it with the movement towards fine leg
length, movement away, and he drives. There's a wobble at cover by Manish Pandey, and that allows Finch to pick up runs
length, swing away, and he drives to cover
length, and he flicks this towards short mid-wicket
short, and he flicks this away towards deep backward square leg
length, jags back into him, and he whips this away towards square leg
length, punched towards cover

length, and he goes on top of the bounce and plays this towards point. Beats the man at point, Jadeja, diving away to his left, and then races away to the right of third man. Terrific shot again from Finch!
fuller, wider, and he plays over the line of this. Looks for the drive, but misses out
length, but width on offer, and he flogs this inside out. Not off the middle, but good enough to go one and two bounces into the extra cover fence. Off the outside edge too
plays a length ball towards cover
length, and he looks to go towards mid-wicket. Skews the bat and it goes off towards long leg. A bit of movement back in, nearly defeats him, but not enough
full, but too wide. Left alone
short, and he hops to ride the bounce and defend it
length, and he picks it early. Outside off, and he has swatted this way over mid-wicket. Big six! A bit of glove love from the captain, as Warner announces his arrival in this series
looks for the fuller ball, and overcooks it a touch. Some late swing in, but Warner covers it to play it out towards cover, all along the ground
length, around off, and he stretches forward to bisect the gap between mid-off and cover. Top shot again!
length, cut away towards point
short of a length, and some width, and Finch helps this along past point and cover-point. Super shot again, as the infielders are mere spectators at the moment
length, straightens after pitching, and he drives this towards mid-wicket
length, around off, and he steers this towards third man
length, and he runs this down towards third man, with an open face of the bat
fuller ball, a bit of movement back in, and he smacks this through extra cover. Just gets his feet out of the way, and that makes enough room for him to execute this shot to perfection!
slower ball, around off, and he taps this away towards point and picks up a quick single
length, outside off, and he runs this down to third man
length, and he punches this through covers. The man there is unable to stop it, but Kohli goes across from mid-off and saves two runs
short, but down the leg side. Warner lets this pass
slower ball, scrambled seam, but not much of a difference. Warner rocks back, and just pumps it inside out. Rasping cut over the infield, and there's no protection at the sweeper cover fence
length, angles in, and he plays it towards short mid-wicket
gets the leading edge, but this hasn't carried to cover! Wrong 'un, and he looks to play this with turn coming in, and ends up top-edging it, but it lands shy of Shreyas Iyer
sharp turn away from Warner, and he plays off the back foot. Cut towards point, and there's a throw at the non-striker's end that hits Kuldeep and goes off for an overthrow
presses forward to defend
ooh, another edge! Finch looks to flog one around off, and again goes off the top edge, and flies towards third man
hit hard towards Kohli at cover
wrong 'un, and he plays it late towards short third man
length, and he stretches forward to defend
length, a bit slower, outside off, and he drives this towards cover. Didn't come on to the bat at all
length, slants in, and he looks to flick this away. Off his pad towards short fine leg
length, and he presses forward to drive it back towards Jadeja
length, around off, and he has swung this wide of deep mid-wicket. All the way, and hits the boundary skirting on the full
short, and he goes back to cut this in front of square on the off side
length, turns back in, and he drives this off the back foot towards point
wrong 'un, and he goes back and punches this towards cover
fuller, and he has flogged this straight back over the bowler. Towards the long-on fence, and over it. It's the 100-run partnership
presses forward to defend a length ball
length, around off, and he drives this towards wide cover
turns back into him from outside off, and he plays this towards cover
short, and he moves into position swiftly and then pulls this in front of square. Really well controlled and placed
beats the outside edge. Length ball, and it bounces a touch extra on its way through, angling across Warner
short of a length, and he rides the bounce and whips it off his pads towards square leg
ooh, top ball! Shapes in from around off and middle, and cuts Finch in half. Moves enough to go over the stumps, and then swings late to go down the leg side. Beats Rahul too
back of a length, and he defends towards point
cuts back in from outside off, and he plays it towards square leg
skips down the wicket, and drives this towards long-off
length, comes back in, and strikes Finch on the pad and bat as he stretches to defend. A feeble appeal, as the impact would have been outside
length, and he goes back to cut. Misses out, and Rahul gets excited at the prospect of a caught-behind
straightens after pitching, and he goes back to play this towards short mid-wicket
fuller, and he drives this towards short mid-wicket
wrong 'un, and he goes back and defends this off the back foot
fuller ball, and he whips this off his pads. Fielded at square leg, and Finch has to go back after being sent back. Good speed on that ball
short, and he just clears short mid-wicket with a little chip shot. Nearly carries to the mid-wicket fence
full, but down the leg side. Finch tries for a whip off his pads, but cannot lay bat on it
yorker, and played well by Finch. Just makes a bit of room to open his stance up and then blocks it away towards short mid-wicket
length, and he taps this away towards point and picks up a single. That's his fifty too!
full ball, around middle and off, and he drives this towards mid-on
length, angles away across him, and he defends with a short forward press
fuller on the stumps, comes forward and blocks
length ball on the pads, flicked towards square leg
tossed up around off, 79.4kph. Comes forward and drives it towards extra cover
wrong'un. Warner didn't pick that up, was looking to defend towards the bowler. The ball takes the inner half and rolls behind square leg
length ball around off, goes back and punches it towards covers
another googly but shorter in length and outside off, Warner cuts it towards backward point
angling onto the pads and then spinning away to take a thick outside edge. Finch was looking to work it on the leg side, gets two as the ball goes past the slip fielder
length ball at the stumps, comes forward and defends
length again, flicked towards short midwicket
length ball on the stumps, smothers it on the front foot
angling on to the pads this time, tucked away towards backward square leg
short of length, enough room outside off, goes back and slaps it through covers
more runs, short of length outside off, and Finch doesn't miss out. Cuts it through point for four more
fuller outside off, pushes it towards covers gently and sets off, makes it comfortably
fuller outside off and driven towards deep extra cover, Warner is quick enough to come back for the second
length ball on the stumps, looked like a googly, Warner goes back and turns it towards short midwicket
tossed up outside off, drives it inside out towards deep extra cover
fuller on the stumps, nudges it towards extra cover
89.3kph, fuller around off, defended from the crease
length ball sliding down the leg side, Warner was over-balanced while going for a flick, Rahul fails to collect but it brushed only the pad. The umpire though signals wide
short outside off, not much turn there, Warner rocks back and cuts it past point for four
fuller on the stumps, pushed towards long-on
length ball around off, pushes it towards point

length ball at the stumps, Finch presses forward but misses and is struck on the front pad. A loud appeal for lbw but not given. Jadeja is confident and India go for the review. An inside edge, replays show
length ball on the pads, flicked towards backward square leg

a wrong'un to beat the bat. Finch came forward to defend but it spun past the outside edge. Rahul whips the bails off, the foot was in the air for a fraction and they have gone for the third umpire. Replays show what players seem to know already, the foot is grounded back when the bails came off
fuller around off, a traditional sweep for a single to deep square leg
length ball on the stumps, comes forward and defends
tossed up on the stumps, backs away and drills it through extra cover. Kohli dives to his left but can only get his fingers on it
fuller on the stumps, drives it towards extra cover
length ball down the leg side and spinning further away, called a wide

length ball on the stumps, Finch comes forward to defend but it spins back to hit the pad. Another loud appeal but umpire Shamshuddin says not-out. Kohli is aghast. He inquiring with the umpire who, it seems, signals height was the issue. The ball tracking shows the ball was spinning down and would have just clipped the leg stump. India don't have a review but it would have been umpire's call only
length ball around off, coming in with the angle, defended
length ball on middle and leg, tucked away towards square leg
length outside off, goes for the cut but ends up chopping it into the ground. A single as the ball dribbles towards deep cover
brilliant from Jadeja. Short and wide and Finch bludgeons it. Jadeja flings himself to his right at backward point and makes a one-handed stop
a bouncer this time and pulled towards deep-backward square leg
fuller outside off, stays leg side of the ball and steers it towards deep cover
fuller, tossed up at the stumps, uses his feet to dig it out towards mid-on
fuller on the pads, flicked towards midwicket
fuller on the stumps, sweeps it towards deep square leg for a couple
length ball and spinning in. Finch was caught on the back foot but just manages to get some bat on it, a single to fine leg and with that, 150 comes up for Australia
flighted outside off, Warner skips down the track, wasn't to the exact pitch of the ball but with the mid-on up, he goes for it and makes a good enough connection to clear the boundary on the full
short of length outside off, cuts it towards backward point
fuller and wider outside off, Finch stays leg side of the ball and steers it towards extra cover

short outside off, Finch helps it over backward point, it went to the right of third man, Kuldeep almost makes a mess of it as the ball gets entangled in his leg after he pushes it back. Eventually it stops just inside
short and wide and cuts it through point, no chance whatsoever for Kuldeep this time around
length ball around off, defended from the crease
fuller on the stumps, drives it towards mid-on
length ball outside off, a deft touch from Finch to run it to the left of Kuldeep who puts in the slide, gets his hand to it but fails to flick it back, the ball rolls away and touches the skirting
fuller on the stumps, Warner comes forward and looks to drive but the ball spins in to take the inside edge. Rahul cannot grab it and it runs away for four
fuller around middle and off, pushed towards long-off
length ball at the stumps, comes forward and blocks
length ball around off, goes back and punches it towards sweeper cover
length ball around off, pushes it towards cover-point
length ball around off, comes forward and blocks
and he starts with a wide down the leg side
length ball on middle and leg, flicked towards backward square leg
length ball at the stumps, backs away and taps it towards point
a bouncer just outside of, Warner bends a little and helps it towards third man
length ball on middle and leg, flicked towards square leg
length ball around off, stays back and defends on the off side
fuller on the leg stump, flicked towards midwicket
length ball around off, stays in the crease and defends
length ball outside off, pushes it towards sweeper cover from the back foot
length ball at the stumps, backs away and punches it towards extra cover
fuller around off, comes forward and flicks it towards square leg
length ball on the pads, misses the flick but collects a leg-bye
length ball around off, spins back a bit as Warner mistimes the cut into the ground
fuller around off, drives it towards sweeper cover
length ball around off, punches it towards covers
length ball on the pads, misses the flick but gets another leg-bye
short of length outside off, Warner  leaves that alone
short again but down the leg side this time, pulls it fine, to the left of Kuldeep at fine leg for a boundary
short again, pulls it towards the fielder this time, a single to fine leg
length ball on the pads, flicked towards fine leg, moves into the 90s
fuller on the toes, misses the flick but gets a leg-bye to short fine leg
length ball around off, punched towards covers
length ball at the stumps, stays back and blocks
given lbw but reviewed straightaway by Warner. Was fuller on the stumps, Warner was looking to paddle it fine. Replays show there was an inside edge onto the pads
length ball around off, comes forward and blocks
length ball around off, sweeps it towards deep-backward square leg
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
dropped short, width on offer. Warner rocks back and smashes it to the deep extra cover boundary
length ball outside off, cuts it towards sweeper cover
fuller around off, drives it towards long-off
flatter and a touch quicker, length ball at the stumps, Warner cuts it towards sweeper cover
short of length at the batsman, Warner dabs it towards short third man. Warner was looking for a single but retraces in time. Jadeja fires in the throw but misses. Good back-up by Iyer there
18th ODI hundred for Warner, brings out the trademark celebration. Was a short of length delivery and he cut it behind point for four. A brilliant knock from Warner and he's not done yet
a bouncer in response. Goes for the pull but it's too high to connect
fuller outside off, squeezes it out towards point
short again, just outside off, Warner looks to ramp it over but fails to connect
fuller around off and middle and driven past mid-off, it's looking all too easy for Warner at the moment
length ball on middle and leg, Finch misses the flick and is hit on the pads, was spinning down though
Finch gets into the act, lofted inside out with mid-off inside the circle. Tossed up around off, Finch comes forward and just uses his hand to hit it up and over
length ball around off, defended
short of length outside off, goes back and cuts it towards sweeper cover
length ball pitching on the leg stump and spinning down. Called a wide
a low full toss at the stumps, driven firmly towards the left of mid-off, Pandey makes a tumbling stop there
length ball around off, punched towards covers
length ball angling but Finch stays leg side once again and nudges it towards covers
fuller around off and middle, clears his front leg and looks to hit down the ground, mistimes it towards mid-off
short this time, pulled towards deep square leg
another short one. Finch pulls it down in front of square leg
short of length outside off, backs away and hits it past the diving extra cover, beats the man at deep cover as well
slower one but outside off, Warner picks it up and drills it between extra cover and mid-off
some turn back from a length, and Finch just gets some bat as he stretches to defend
length, and he goes back and defends one that turns back a touch into him
sweeps hard, and gets it down towards long leg
length, and he flogs this down towards deep mid-wicket
length, and he goes back and nurdles this away towards deep backward square leg
length, and he goes back and cuts this towards point
length, and he knocks this towards point. Picks up a quick single
tries the reverse sweep. Flicked on to body, but drops ahead of him
length, pushed down the wicket past Jadeja towards long-off
length, and he defends one that straightens after pitching around leg

that could be his century, and is! Down the leg side, and he just needed to get something on it with a sweep. Jogs over and punches gloves with Warner. Takes his helmet off to soak up the applause. What an innings. The man who started the momentum in this mammoth partnership
steers this to the left of cover, and picks up a single
length, tapped away past point and picks up two easily
length, and he plays a delicate late cut. Played fine enough to beat third man
length, angles in, and he plays this towards point
dug in short, and he looks to back away and play the upper cut. No contact with ball as it slants across him towards Rahul. One short ball called for the over
wide of the crease, fuller, and he drives this hard towards cover
looks for the yorker, ends up bowling a yorker around leg stump. Played to the left of mid-on, and they scurry through for a quick single
short of a length, and he goes back and drives this hard. Cannot beat cover
flicks one off his pads towards square leg
length, and he drops this around off stump, played towards point
angles into him, and he plays this away to the left of short fine-leg with a little flick of the wrists
short, and he cuts this away. Past point, but the man will run across and keep it down to two
length, around leg, and he plonks this away towards deep square leg. Wants two, but settles for one
short of a length, and he goes back and drags this towards mid-wicket
fuller ball, wider of off, and he drives this towards mid-off
short, called wide as it bounces well over his head
short, down leg side, and he helps it away to the long leg fence. Just uses the pace of the ball

places this past mid-off, and lets out a celebratory yelp. The batsmen embrace, and this one is done and dusted! Australia do it in stye, with the highest partnership for any wicket in ODI cricket against India!
